question: Which of the following Biomedical wastes cannot be disposed off in yellow bags?
exp: Yellow color bags are used for disposal of: BMW Cat 1: Human anatomical wastes BMW Cat 2: Animal wastes BMW Cat 3: Microbiological and biotechnology waste BMW Cat 6: Soiled waste Container/bags are not required for disposal of BMW Cat 8: Liquid waste BMW Cat 10: Chemical waste BMW Cat 3: (if disinfected locally): Microbiological and biotechnology waste Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 827
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: In ESI programme central, state, Govt. Employee contribute to the fund. Employer's contribution is -
exp: - ESI scheme is run by contributions by employees and employers and grants from central and state governments. - the employer contributes 4. 75 percent of total wage bill. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 816 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Diffuse mesothelioma is seen with -
exp: - asbestos enters the body by inhalation and fine dust may be deposited in the alveoli. - the dust deposited in the lungs causes pulmonary fibrosis leading to respiratory insufficiency and death. - it also causes mesothelioma of the pleura or peritoneum. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: In PHC how to dispose placenta -
exp: - placenta is a human anatomical waste that comes under category no 1. - category no 1 wastes are discarded in yellow colour plastic bag and should be treated by incineration. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 793, 794 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: True about composition of hospital waste
exp: - the average composition of hospital wastes in India is; - 15% - 10% metals- 1% infectious wastes-1. 5% -4% wastes-53. 5% Reference: Park&; s textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 790, table 2. <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Waste in yellow plastic bags are treated by
exp: Waste such as anatomical waste, solid waste, soiled waste, chemical waste is collected in yellow coloured bag and treated and disposed by incineration
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: ESI act was made in -
exp: - the ESI act passed in 1948 is an impoant measure of social security and health insurance in the country. - it provides for ceain cash and medical benefits to industrial employees in case of sickness, maternity and employment injury. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 815 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Employee's contribution to Employee State Insurance
exp: According to ESI Act amendment 2019
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: In disaster management all are true except
exp: STAGES OF DISASTER CYCLE: Disaster mitigation: Measures designed to either prevent hazards from causing emergency or to lessen the effects of emergency Disaster preparedness Disaster impact Disaster response: Search rescue and first aid, field care, Triage, Tagging, Identification of dead Stage of health and medical relief: Disaster containment Rehabilitation: Water supply, Sanitation and personal hygiene, Food safety, Vector control Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 833
opc: Yellow colour is for medium priority
opd: Gastroenteritis is commonest infection after disaster
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: What is the propoion of daily rate wages payable as periodic cash payment under sickness Benefit of ESI Act -
exp: Under sickness benefit of ESI the benefit is payable for a maximum period of 91 days, in any continous period of 365 days, the Daily rate being about 50% of average daily wage. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 757)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: True about screw feed technology
exp: Screw-feed technology is the basis of a non-burn, dry thermal disinfection process in which waste is shredded and heated in a rotating auger. The waste is reduced by 80 percent in volume and by 25-35 percent in weight. This process is suitable for treating infectious waste and sharps. Should not be used to process pathological, cytotoxic or radioactive waste. Park 23e pg: 792
opa: Waste is reduced by 80% in volume and by 20-35% in weight
opb: Waste is reduced by 85% in volume and by 10-20% in weight
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: What percentatge of the healthcare waste generated is infectious?
exp: - about 80% of health care wastes accounts for general health care wastes. - 1% accounts for sharps - 15% is pathological and infectious wastes. - 3% chemical and pharmacological wastes. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 790 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: The maximum hours of work per week prescribed under the Factories Act is -
exp: As per factories Act, a maximum of 48 hours per week, not exceeding 9 hours per day. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 756)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which of the following diseases needs not to be screened for, in workers to be employed in a dye industry in gujarat?
exp: Prepalcement examination in dye industries include asthma, skin and bladder, kidney diseases, precancerous lesion. Anemia comes under lead. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 753)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Of all the following, incineration is done for -
exp: - wastes types not to be incinerated are; pressurized gas container or radiographic wastes. plastics sealed ampules wastes with mercury or cadmium content. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 791 <\p>

question: The cancerogenic chemical that has a very long latent period is -
exp: Asbestos exposure for a long period causes asbestosis. They entire the body through inhalation and are deposited in the alveoli. The long exposure of dust can lead to carcinoma of bronchus. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 748)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: High priority triage is for -
exp: -triage consists of rapidly classifying the injured on the basis of severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention. - red colour triage indicates high priority treatment or transfer. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 796 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: All of the following are common causes of epidemic after a disaster except -
exp: After a disaster many disease can occur through infection through water, food, vector and due to improper sanitation. Dengue fever, leptospirosis, typhus and plagues are some of them. Flood water provide ample breeding oppounities for mosquito. REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 739)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Cause of Farmer's lung-
exp: - farmers lungs is due to the inhalation of mouldy or hay grain dust. - micropolyspora faeni is the main cause of farmer's lung. - repeated attacks cause pulmonary fibrosis, inevitable pulmonary damage and cor pulmonale. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Hospital waste product accounts
exp: The average composition of hospital wastes in India is: - 15% rags -15% - 10% metals- 1% infectious wastes-1. 5% -4% wastes-53. 5% Reference: Park&; s textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 790, table 2

question: Minimum duration of developing coal miners pneumoconiosis is -
exp: - The coal miners pneumoconiosis has two phases; first phase is simple pneumoconiosis which is associated with little ventilatory impairment. - this phase may require about 12 years of work exposure for its development. - second phase is characterized by progressive massive fibrosis Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 806 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Thermophiliac actinomycesis is associated with?
exp: - bagassosis is the occupational disease of the lung caused by inhalation of bagasse or sugarcane dust. - due to thermophilic actinomycete Thermoactinomyces sacchari. - symptoms include breathlessness, cough, hemoptysis and slight fever. - if left untreated, diffuse fibrosis, emphysema and bronchiectasis occurs. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23 rd edition, pg no 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Baggasosis is caused by dust of?
exp: - bagassosis is the occupational disease of the lung caused by inhalation of bagasse or sugarcane dust. - due to thermophilic actinomycete Thermoactinomyces sacchari. - symptoms include breathlessness, cough, hemoptysis and slight fever. - if left untreated, diffuse fibrosis, emphysema and bronchiectasis occurs. question: Useful screening test for lead is measurement of:
exp: Diagnosis of lead poisoning: Laboratory parameters Remark Coproporphyrin in Urine (CPU) > 150 mcg/L Exposure to lead Amino levulinic acid in Urine (ALAU) > 5 mg/l Indicates lead absorption Lead in blood >70 mcg/100 ml Clinical symptoms appear Lead in Urine >0. 8 mg/l Lead exposure and absorption Basophilic stripling of RBC&; s Punctate basophilia Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 845
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: ESI act is not applicable for -
exp: THE EMPLOYEES STATE INSURANCE ACE, 1948 is An impoant measure of social security and health insurance. It cover all power using factories other than seasonal factories wherein 10 or more persons were employed. Now it is extended to shops, newspaper establishments, cinema and theatre., small factories employing 10 or more persons whether power is used or not. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 757)
opb: Power working factory employing 10 people or more
opc: Non power working factory employing 20 people or more

question: The factories Act (1976) prohibits employmnet of a person below -
exp: The Act prohibits the employment of children&; s below the age of 14 years and declares persons between 15-18 to be adolescents. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 756)

question: Socio-security measures that are provided to the workers by which of the following Act/Acts-
exp: The factories Act, 1948 and ESIAct, 1948 are the two acts that provide socio security measures to workers. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 755)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Byssinosis is most commonly seen in?
exp: - byssinosis is due to inhalation of cotton fibre dust over long periods of time. - the symptoms are chronic cough and progressive dyspnoea ending in chronic bronchitis and emphysema. - India has a large textile industry employing 35 percent of factory workers and incidence of this disease is repoed to be 7-8 percent. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 806 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: The disaster cycle progresses from -
exp: - disaster management has three fundamental aspects; disaster response disaster preparedness disaster mitigation - the disaster cycle progress from response, rehabilitation, reconstruction, mitigation and preparedness. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 795, 796 <\p>

question: Black color in triage -
exp: - triage consists of rapidly classifying the injured on the basis of severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention. - black colour triage signals dead or moribund patients. question: Respirable dust, responsible for pneumoconiosis, has a size limit of:
exp: Pneumoconiosis occur due to occupational exposure to dust. Paicles size 0. 5 to 3. 0 microns are the most dangerous (as a health hazard causing pneumoconiosis), as they reach the interior of lungs with ease. Paicles size and behaviour: Paicle size Behaviour >10 microns Settle down by gravity <10 microns Remain suspended in air 5-10 microns Arrested in upper respiratory tract 3-5 microns Deposited in mid respiratory tract 1-3 microns Enter alveoli and settle there (cause pneumoconiosis) <1 more Brownian movement Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 843
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which of the following is true under Factories Act of 1976?
exp: The factory Act, 1948 NO child <14 years age shall be required or allowed to work in any factory A child >14 years age or an adolescent (15-18 years age) shall allowed to work in any factory if they get a ceificate of fitness from a surgeon No child shall be employed to work in any factory for >4 1/2 hours in any day and during night. No female child shall be allowed to work in any factory except between 8. AM to 7. PM. No female/male adolescent shall be allowed to work except between 6 AM to 7. PM Women and children cannot be employed in dangerous works Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 852
opa: Children aged less than 14 years are prohibited from any employment
opb: Adolescents aged from 15-18 years can work between 7 pm and 6 am
opc: Women and children can be employed in all type of works
opd: Adolescents of 16 years need not be duly ceified as fit for work by ceifying surgeon
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

exp: -bagassosis is the occupational disease of the lung caused by inhalation of bagasse or sugarcane dust. question: The size of Respirable dust is -
exp: - dust paicles smaller than 5 microns are directly inhaled into the lungs and are retained there. This fraction of dust is called respirable dust. - it is mainly responsible for pneumoconiosis. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 805 <\p>

question: The extended sickness benefit is given for?

question: True about ineization is
exp: Ineization. The process involves mixing waste with cement and other substances before disposal, in order to minimize the risk of toxic substances contained in the wastes migrating into the surface water or groundwater. A typical propoion of the mixture is 65% pharmaceutical waste, 15% lime, 15% cement, and 5% water.
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23 rd edition, pg no 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Pharmaceutical waste includes
exp: Pharmaceutical waste: Pharmaceuticals that are expired or no longer needed; Items containing or contaminated by pharmaceuticals. Genotoxic waste: Waste containing substances with genotoxic propeies Ex: cytostatic drugs (often used in chemotherapy). Chemical waste: Lab reagents, film developer, solvents, disinfectants Park 23e pg: 789
opa: Waste containing body pas, blood, and other body fluids
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Solid waste is treated by
exp: Solid waste can be treated by incineration, autoclaving, microwaving, mutilation/shredding. Park 23e pg: 792
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: A known HIV positive patient is admitted in an isolation ward after an abdominal surgery following an accident. The resident doctor who changed his dressing the next day found it to be soaked in blood. Which of the following would be right method of choice of discarding the dressing
exp: Solid wastes contaminated with blood and fluids including cotton, dressing, soiled plaster castes comes under Category no 6. - category no 6 wastes are discarded in appropriate colour plastic bag and treated by incineration, autoclaving and microwaving. Reference: Park&; s textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 793, 794
opa: Pour 1% hypochloric on the dressing material and send it for incineration in an appropriate bag
opb: Pour 5% hypochlorite on the dressing material and send it for incineration in an appropriate bag
opc: Put the dressing material directly in an appropriate bag and send for incineration
opd: Pour 2% Lysol on the dressing material and send it for incineration in a appropriate bag
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Sickness absenteeism is a useful to assess
exp: Ref: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25 th Ed
opc: Status of the health of the workers
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: True about triage -
exp: - triage consists of rapidly classifying the injured on the basis of severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention. - red colour triage indicates high priority treatment or transfer, yellow signals medium priority, green indicates ambulatory patients and black for dead and moribund patients. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 796 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: The plastic cover of syringes are disposed of in
exp: Wrapper in Black Syringe without needle - RED Needle - White
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: &; Safety officers&; have to be appointed in factories when no. of workers more than -
exp: The factories Act, 1948: Health, Safety and Welfare recommendation: A minimum of 500 cubic feet space per worker 1 safety officer per 100 wrokers 1 welfare officer per 500 workers 1 Canteen for greater than 250 workers 1 Creche for greater than 30 women workers Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 852
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: The industry, with the highest accidental death rate and long held to be the most dangerous occupation is -
exp: Mining and quarrying is the most dangerous occupational disease. They could be silicosis, Anthracosis, Byssinosis, Baggasosis. They reduce the working capacity due to lung fibrosis and other complications. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO-747)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: According to the Workmen's Compensation Act 1923 which of the following is considered as an occupational disease
exp: Ref: Park's Textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th Ed
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Sources of health waste
exp: Hospitals, animal houses, research labs, blood banks.. etc all generate healthcare- waste and therefore, covered under Bio-medical waste rules. Park 23e pg: 789
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Mesothelioma is caused by -
exp: - asbestos enters the body by inhalation and fine dust may be deposited in the alveoli. - the dust deposited in the lungs causes pulmonary fibrosis leading to respiratory insufficiency and death. - also causes mesothelioma of the pleura or peritoneum. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Solid waste is seen in category
exp: Categories of bio-medical waste in India. Category No. Waste category1. Human anatomical waste2. Animal waste3. Microbiology and biotechnology waste4. Sharps5. Discarded medicines and cytotoxic drugs6. Solid waste 7. Solid waste 8. Liquid waste9. Incineration ash10. Chemicals used in the production of biologicals. Ref: Park; 23rd ed; Pg 793
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Ergonomics-
exp: - the term ergonomics is derived from ergon, meaning work and nomos, meaning law. - it simply means fitting the job to the worker. - the objective of ergonomics is to achieve the best mutual adjustment of man and his work for the improvement of human efficiency and well-being. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 803 <\p>
opa: Adjusting the Worker to his job
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Sputum is disinfected by -
exp: Disinfection of sputum is by incineration. incineration is a high temperature dry oxidation process, that reduce organic and combustible waste ti inorganic incombustible matter. REF. PARKS TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICINE 21 edition. PAGE NO-731, 743)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which of the following is not a fundamental aspect fo Disaster management?
exp: -disaster management has three fundamental aspects; disaster response disaster preparedness disaster mitigation - the disaster cycle progress from response, rehabilitation, reconstruction, mitigation and preparedness. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 795, 796 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Preplacement examination in dye industry includes all of the following except -
exp: Anemia is the preplacement examination in case of lead or in lead industries. all other are included under dye industry. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 753)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Incineration is done for -
exp: - human anatomical wastes are treated by incineration. - wastes types not to be incinerated are; pressurized gas container or radiographic wastes. plastics sealed ampules wastes with mercury or cadmium content. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 791, 793 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which waste cannot be incinerated-
exp: - wastes types not to be incinerated are; pressurized gas container or radiographic wastes. plastics sealed ampules wastes with mercury or cadmium content. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 791 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: All of the following are Standards laid down by the Factories Act except-
exp: The Factory Act defines factory as an establishment employing 10 or more workers where the power is used and 20 or more workers where the power is not used. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 755)
opa: Minimum 500 cubic feet space per worker
opb: Maximum working hours including oveime per week; 60 hours
opc: Defines any factory that employs 10 or more workers where power is not used-
opd: Probihition of employment of children below 14 years of age
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Chimney Sweeper cancer is the other name for
exp: Ref: Park's textbook of Preventive and Social Medicine 25th Ed
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Biodegradable waste products are disposed in which color bag?
exp: Human anatomical waste (Cat 1), Animal waste (Cat 2), Microbiology and biotechnology waste (Cat 3) Solid wastes (Cat 6; Items contaminated with blood and fluids including dressings, beddings) are all disposed of in a yellow bag.
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Medium priority colour code in triage -
exp: - triage consists of rapidly classifying the injured on the basis of severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention. - yellow signals medium priority triage. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 796 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Under ESI, the duration of sickness benefit arising out of confinement is for -
exp: - the ESI act passed in 1948 is an impoant measure of social security and health insurance in the country. - it provides for ceain cash and medical benefits to industrial employees in case of sickness, maternity and employment injury. - maternity benefit is payable cash to an insured woman for confinement/ miscarriage or sicknesses arising out of confinement. -the duration of benefit for sickness arising out of confinement is 30 days. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 815, 817 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: All of the following are true for occupational lead poisoning except -
exp: Lead poisoning occurs as inhalation and ingestion. Measuremwnts of lead in blood and urine provide quantitative indicators of exposure. Lead in urine of over 0. 8mg/litre indicates lead exposure. A blood level of 70microgram/100 ml is associated with clinical symptoms. Basophilic stipling of RBC is a. sensitive parameter of the haematological response. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 748, 749)
opa: Inhalation is the most common mode of absorption
opb: Lead in blood and urine provide quantitative indicators of exposure
opc: Average blood is more impoant than number of subjects with blood levels above threshold
opd: Basophilic stippling is a sensitive parameter of hematological response
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: All of the following statements regarding disposal of biomedical waste are true, except -
exp: - the sharps including needles and scalpel comes under Category no. 4 and is disposed in blue plastic bag. - it should be disinfected by chemical treatment, autoclaving, microwaving and mutilation shredding. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 793 <\p>
opa: Human Anatomical Waste is disposed in a Yellow bag
opb: Contents from a Red bag may be a source of contamination
opc: Black bags are used for disposal of ash from incineration
opd: Blue bags contents are disposed in secured landfill
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Average hospital waste produced per bed per day in Government hospital-
exp: - according to survey done in Bangalore, the quantity of solid waste generated in government hospitals is half to four kilograms per bed per day. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 790 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Patient requiring immediate referral is alloted what color code according to IMNCI color coding?
exp: IMNCI has divided on the basis of colour coded treatment. PINK-urgent referral, YELLOW-Treatment at outpatient facility, GREEN-Home management. (REF. PARK&; S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICAL 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 414)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Biodegrable waste products, disposing in which of the colour code of the bags -
exp: - human anatomical wastes including human tissues, organs and body pas comes under category no. 1. - category no 1 wastes are discarded in yellow colour plastic bag. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 793, 794 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: The primary goal of Human genome project has been:
exp: HUMAN GENOME PROJECT: Human genome project: HGP is an international scientific research project Primary goals were to determine the sequence of chemical base pairs which make up DNA and to identify the approximately 25, 000 genes of the human genome They also want to understand it and complete a map of all their findings The project began in 1990 initially headed by James D. Watson Ongoing sequencing led to the announcement of the essentially genome in April 2003. The goals of the original HGP were not only to determine more than 3 billion base pairs in the human genome, but also to identify all the genes in this vast amount of data This pa of the project is still ongoing, although a preliminary count indicates about 22, 000-23, 000 genes in the human genome Ref: park 25th edition Pgno: 863
opa: Introduction of a gene sequence into a cell to modify its behavior
opb: Development of new diagnostic techniques such as restriction enzymes
opc: Identify genes and sequence of base pairs in DNA of human genomes
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Benefits under the Employees State Insurance scheme include all the following except -
exp: Benefits are medical benefits, sickness benefits, maternity benefits, disablement benefits, dependent's benefits, funeral benefits rehabilitation. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 757)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which is the calamity with most amount of damage-
exp: Damage to health facilities and damage to water systems are severe in case of floods. (PARK'S textbook of PREVENTIVE and SOCIAL MEDICINE 21st edition page no. 737 table 1)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Marriage between two heterozygous individuals for the same disorder is prevented by:
exp: GENETIC COUNSELLING: Prospective genetic counselling: Identify heterozygous individuals for any paicular defect (through screening) and explaining to them risk if having affected children if they marry another heterozygous for same gene Useful in sickle cell anemia, Thalassemia Retrospective genetic counselling: Seeking genetic advice after hereditary disorder has already occured in the family. useful in: Congenital anomalies, Mental retardation, Psychiatric illness, Inborn errrors of metabolism Ref: Park 25th edition Pgno: 865
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Sickness benefit under ESI is available for a period of -
exp: The sicknesses benefit is payable for a maximum period of 91 days, in any continuous period of 365 days. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 757)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Duration of maternal benefit under ESI acts is -
exp: - the ESI act passed in 1948 is an impoant measure of social security and health insurance in the country. - it provides for ceain cash and medical benefits to industrial employees in case of sickness, maternity and employment injury. - maternity benefit is payable cash to an insured woman for confinement/ miscarriage or sicknesses arising out of confinement. -the duration of benefit for confinement is 12 weeks or 84 days. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 815, 817 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Which fungicide is used as a spray for the control of bagassosis-
exp: - bagassosis is the occupational disease of lung caused by inhalation of sugarcane dust. - it is caused due to a thermophilic actinomycete, Thermoactinomyces sacchari. - preventive measures include bagasse control done by keeping the moisture content above 20 percent and spraying the bagasse with 2 percent propionic acid, a widely fungicide. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 807 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Me thod for waste disposal in small camps-
exp: Burial is suited for small camps. (Ref PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 697)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: For the disposal of hospital refuse, the bag made with cadmium is not used because incineration of the bag causes poisonous toxic fumes evolution. The colour of the bag is -
exp: Waste collection bags for waste type needing incineration shall not be made of chlorinated plastics. REF. PARK'S TEXTBOOK OF PREVENTIVE AND SOCIAL MEDICINE 21. ST EDITION. PAGE NO - 735
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Animal waste such as placenta is disposed by-
exp: - animal wastes comes under category no 2 of biomedical wastes. - it should be disposed by incineration. Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 793 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Black colour code is used in four code system of triage management in disaster for -
exp: -triage consists of rapidly classifying the injured on the basis of severity of their injuries and the likelihood of their survival with prompt medical intervention. - black colour triage is for moribund and dead patients Reference: Park's textbook of preventive and social medicine, 23rd edition, pg no: 796 <\p>
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health

question: Most common mode of lead poisoning-
exp: Mode. of absorption of lead is by inhalation, ingestion and through skin. Most cases of industrial lead poisoning is due to inhalation of fumes and dust of lead or its compounds. (Ref. PARK'S textbook of preventive and social medicine 21st edition page no. 748)
topic_name: Hospital waste and disaster management, Occupational health
